name: Turkey Basil Meatballs in Tomato Sauce with Quinoa and Green Beans
description: Juicy turkey meatballs simmered in a mild tomato-garlic basil sauce, served over fluffy chicken-stock quinoa with crisp-tender green beans. High-protein and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Trim 400 g green beans, cut any long ones in half.
Set out a large oven-safe skillet and a medium saucepan with lid.
cook_steps: Start sauce: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in the oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook 4–5 minutes until translucent. Add half the minced garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add 800 g crushed tomatoes, half the chopped basil, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Simmer on low while you form meatballs.
Mix meatballs: In a bowl, combine 800 g turkey, remaining minced garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Gently mix and form 16 golf-ball-sized meatballs.
Sear meatballs: Increase skillet to medium-high, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Nestle meatballs into the pan, sear 2 minutes, turn to sear another 2 minutes.
Bake to finish: Spoon some sauce over the meatballs, transfer skillet to the oven, and bake 12–15 minutes until meatballs are cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F).
Cook quinoa: In the saucepan, bring 3 cups chicken stock to a boil. Stir in rinsed quinoa, reduce to low, cover, and cook 15 minutes. Rest off heat 5 minutes, then fluff.
Cook green beans: While quinoa cooks, bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add green beans and cook 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain and toss with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt.
Finish and serve: Stir remaining basil into the tomato sauce. Plate quinoa, top with meatballs and sauce, and serve green beans on the side.
